xeno_early_start.gameplay.not_enough_fue: This primitive fire have no fuel to burn, throw some burnable before relighting
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.earl: Random Tick(s) Required for Brick To Finish Drying
Each random ticks occur every ~47.3 second at default tick speed
Fuel Time Required For Max Light Level (%)
Maximum Burn Time Primitive Fire Can Hold
Multiple To Fuel Time Fuel Gives
Amount Of Time Primitive Fire Gain When Fire Starter Is Used To Relight
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.mobC: Probability Of Mob Spawning With Copper Tool
Probability Of Mob Spawning With Equipment
A flat, additive increase to the probability a mob is spawned with equipment. (There is a small chance they won't be spawned with any even at 100%)
Probability Of Copper Armour Replacing Vanilla Armour On Spawned Mob
Probability only applies to mob already spawning with equipment.
Make Polar Bear Always Aggressive At Player
Follow Range Of A Polar Bear
Only apply on newly spawned mob
Make Some Mob Attack Player That're On Low Health Or Hunger
Make Wolf Aggressive At Player At Night
Bat Gives Player Nausea When Touched
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.oreC: Use vanilla's mining int level, as a workaround for modded pickaxe that didn't register their material to TierSortingRegistry.
Mined ore drop raw ore and replace block with stone/deepslate/netherrack. (p.s. this is a joke, don't enable this in your playthrough)
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.bloc: Damage Dealt When Entity Step On Stonecutter
Damage Dealt When Entity Step On Cooker
Damage Dealt When Entity Step On Brick Furnace
Damage Dealt When Entity Step On Furnace
Damage Dealt When Entity Step On Blast Furnace
Blast Furnace Set Nearby Block On Fire
Damage Multiplier When Player Fall On Amethyst
Fix Vanilla Issue Where Walking On Block With Thin Hitbox Doesn't Play The Correct Sound
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.hung: Exhaustion When Player Wake Up From Bed
Exhaustion When Player Row A Boat
text.config.xeno_early_start.option.clie: DO NOT ENABLE THIS unless you already know how this mod works
text.config.xeno_early_start.title: Progression Change
text.emi.xeno_early_start.fire_starter_n: Fire Starter can be used on any fuel item
death.damage.coral_0: %s found out coral isn't fun to step on
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.guide: Read the advancement page for more info on how to get started!
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.guide_more: Right click this item or use keybind:
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.fire_start: Can be created with fire starter
Can be used to create a primitive fire, or to relight an extinguished fire for §p%s§f minute(s)
Requires §p%s§r minute(s) worth of dropped burnables (at least §p%s§r sticks) to create a new primitive fire
Has a 25 chance of success, 50 when in dry biome, but always fails in rain
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.raw_brick: Dries into a brick when placed down and exposed to sun unobstructed
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.raw_brick_: Drying progress reset when exposed to rain, this can be avoided by placing glass over the raw brick, at the cost of drying speed
It is also advisable to protect the raw brick from being trample on by zombie
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.brick_thro: Throwable (please exercise caution and restraint near glass)
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.brick_obta: Can also be obtained by drying raw brick
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.primitive_: Fuel will slowly deplete, throw burnables to refill
Can hold up to §p%s§f minute(s) worth of burn time (equivalent to §p%s§f sticks)
Flint and Steel or Fire Starter is required to relight
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.plant_fibe: Obtained by breaking grass/leaves with shards (e.g. flint/knapped stone)
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.pebble: Obtained by breaking stone/its cobbled variant with pickaxe below copper tier
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.pebble_to_: Use on a cobbled block with pebble on both hand to obtain knapped stone
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.shards: Breaking grass/leaves with this has §p%s§f chance of dropping plant fiber
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.knapped_st: Obtained by clicking on a cobbled block with pebble in both hand
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.food_warni: You probably don't want to eat this
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.raw_food_w: You probably don't want to eat this raw
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.flint: Obtained by breaking gravel (10 chance of success) or clicking gravel on grindstone (20 chance of failure)
xeno_early_start.item.tooltip.starting_g: To get started, find gravel and obtain flint (and check Advancement for guide!)
advancements.xeno_early_start.root.title: Good Luck
advancements.xeno_early_start.animal_fat: Using animal fat or charcoal and extracted sugar, you refined weak wood into a durable substance used for the crafting table and better tools
advancements.xeno_early_start.brick_furn: Construct a brick oven to smelt copper ores
Obtain clay, can be used in combination with charcoal or animal fat to make ‘bricks to be placed out to dry
advancements.xeno_early_start.coal_dust_: Discover the second reason why nobody wants to become a coal miner. (Heat sources Like fire and even torches can cause coal dust to explode)
Discover why nobody wants to become a coal miner
advancements.xeno_early_start.copper.des: Mine and smelt your first ingot of copper
advancements.xeno_early_start.crafting_t: It's not shiny or anything but you did it. Finally.
advancements.xeno_early_start.fire_start: With a fire starter and a pile of dropped burnables, you can cook and burn logs to refine then into charcoal for more advanced recipes
advancements.xeno_early_start.flint_hatc: How bad can I possibly be?
Use a primitive hatchet to fell a tree
advancements.xeno_early_start.flint_pick: Use a rock tied to a stick to get a stone
advancements.xeno_early_start.knapping.d: Learn how to knap small stones to make sharper stones for stronger tools
advancements.xeno_early_start.plant_fibe: Obtain plant fiber, required for most primitive tools
This Might Take A Little Bit
Protect your soggy bricks from rain and undead while they dry.
advancements.xeno_early_start.raw_nugget: Only gold, diamond, or better pickaxes will drop full ore chunks :)
advancements.xeno_early_start.wooden_pic: You might want to get copper first.
